name: Frances Emma Hartley
pob: Butler County, Alabama, United States of America
pod: Georgiana, Butler County, Alabama, United States of America
bio:
Frances Emma Hartley was the daughter of William James Hartley and Rachel Frances Parker (1851-1931).

During her lifetime, Frances would have seen the transformation of rural Alabama from the post-Reconstruction era through the World Wars and into the mid-1960s. The area where she lived, Georgiana, is historically significant as a hub for the timber industry and is notably the boyhood home of country music legend Hank Williams.

Claude Hartley Bennett: Historical records confirm he was a son of Frances Emma Hartley and Martin Herbert Bennett.
